file.title: Файл
file.export-scene-final-cut-proX-and-premiere: Экспортировать сцену для Final Cut Pro X и Premiere

welcome-window.welcome-line-1: Storyboarder просто позволяет визуально отбразить ваши истории как можно быстрее.
welcome-window.welcome-line-2: Вы можете исползовать написанный рассказа, либо создайть совершенно новый файл. Создайте доску, рисуйте на ней, создайте доску, рисуйте на ней и наблюдайте за тем как ваша история оживает. Вы также можете распечатать рабочие листы, рисовать на них и легко импортировать обратно.

light-pencil.title: Light Pencil
light-pencil.description: Draw rough ideas with this tool. Feel free to make mistakes. This tool draws on the reference layer, so you can easily erase these lines.

brush.title: Fill Brush Pen
brush.description: Paint and fill with this tool. The brush pen is a steady stream of ink. This tool draws on the fill layer.

tone.title: Tone Pastel
tone.description: Tone and shade with this tool. This tool draws on the tone layer.

pencil.title: Pencil
pencil.description: Draw and shade details with this tool. It's lighter and softer than the pen. This tool draws on the pencil layer.

pen.title: Ink Marker
pen.description: This tool is for hard thicker lines. Use this tool for final inking and outlining. This tool draws on the ink layer.

note-pen.title: Note Pen
note-pen.description: Revise boards with this tool. Have a note? Draw right on top of the board. This tool draws on the notes layer, so it is easy to erase. This tool draws on the notes layer.

eraser.title: Eraser
eraser.description: Made a mistake? Use the eraser. When holding option (or alt), it will only erase the tool’s layer you’re on. Otherwise, will erase all layers.

current-color.title: Current Color
current-color.description: Click to change the current color.

controls-size.title: Brush Size
controls-size.description: Drag value to increase or decrease the brush size … or just use the key commands like real pros!

controls-stroke-opacity.title: Stroke Opacity
controls-stroke-opacity.description: Drag value to adjust the overall opacity of new strokes.

palette-colorA.title: Palette Color 1
palette-colorA.description: Click to set the current color to this. Hold down to set this color to another.

palette-colorB.title: Palette Color 2
palette-colorB.description: Click to set the current color to this. Hold down to set this color to another.

palette-colorC.title: Palette Color 3
palette-colorC.description: Click to set the current color to this. Hold down to set this color to another.

toolbar-trash.title: Clear Canvas
toolbar-trash.description: Press this to clear the whole drawing! Don't worry! You can always undo.

toolbar-marquee.title: Lasso Tool
toolbar-marquee.description:
Lasso an area of art to manipulate.

Draw to lasso an area. Add to area with SHIFT + draw. Subtract with ALT/OPTION + draw. Press 'f' to fill area with current brush color and opacity. Press DELETE/BACKSPACE to erase area.

Press and hold inside lasso’d area to begin moving, then drag. Fill and erase work after move also.

ENTER to commit. ESCAPE to cancel.

toolbar-undo.title: Undo
toolbar-undo.description: Made a mistake? No problem. You can undo!

toolbar-redo.title: Redo
toolbar-redo.description: Undo too much? You can redo what you've undone.

toolbar-grid.title: Grid Guide
toolbar-grid.description: Toggle a grid used for measured drawings or straight lines.

toolbar-center.title: Center Guide
toolbar-center.description: Toggle centerline guide used to make sure your drawing is centered.

toolbar-thirds.title: Rule of Thirds Guide
toolbar-thirds.description: oggle thirds guide to center focus on the thirds. Any mediocre cinematographer uses this all the time!

toolbar-perspective.title: 3D Guide
toolbar-perspective.description: Match the 3d grid for your generated shot. If you don't have a generated shot, you get an eye level 3d view. Noiiice.

toolbar-onion.title: Onion Skin
toolbar-onion.description: Toggle display of last and next frame so you can tween shots for transitions and animations.

toolbar-captions.title: Captions
toolbar-captions.description: Toggle dialogue caption overlays on and off.

toolbar-open-in-editor.title: Edit in Photoshop
toolbar-open-in-editor.description: Click here to edit the board in Photoshop. When you're done editing, just save the file in Photoshop. It will update in Storyboarder automatically.

toolbar-pomodoro-rest.title: Sketch Sprint
toolbar-pomodoro-rest.description: Set a timer and record a timelapse of your work.

toolbar-pomodoro-running.title: Sketch Sprint
toolbar-pomodoro-running.description: Set a timer and record a timelapse of your work.

line-mileage.title: Line Mileage
line-mileage.description: As you draw, the line miles for the shot add up. This is useful to know how much you are drawing per shot. Remember, you aren't trying to make the next Moner Lisa. You're just trying to get the idea across.

new-shot.title: Is this board a new shot?
new-shot.description: Check this box if the board is a new shot. You can have multiple boards per shot. This way you can animate or make a transition in a shot.

duration-ms.title: Set the board duration
duration-ms.description: Enter the number of milliseconds for a board. There are 1000 milliseconds in a second. 2000 milliseconds is the default.

duration-fps.title: Set the board duration
duration-fps.description: Enter the number of frames for a board.

suggested-dialogue-duration.title: Suggested board duration
suggested-dialogue-duration.description: Click to set the duration based on the dialogue text.

dialogue-tooltip.title: Dialogue for board
dialogue-tooltip.description: Write some really sweet dialogue, like, ''As you know, I am your father.'' It will show up as a caption if you have it toggled on.

action-tooltip.title: Action for board
action-tooltip.description: Write some action for the board.

note-tooltip.title: Clear notes drawing layer
note-tooltip.description: Clear the notes layer for this board. You can also clear it when you are on the notes drawing tool and you press:

clear-note-tooltip.title: Notes for the board
clear-note-tooltip.description: Write some notes. Could be board notes for changes, or just some notes for the shot.

remove-audio.title: Remove audio
remove-audio.description: Remove audio reference from this board. The file will remain on disk unless Clean Up Scene is used.

reference-layer-tooltip.title: Clear reference drawing layer
reference-layer-tooltip.description: Clear the reference layer for this board. You can also clear it when you are on the light pencil drawing tool and you press:

merge-down-tooltip.title: Merge the fill layer down to the reference layer
merge-down-tooltip.description: This is useful if you want to take your existing fill layer and redraw for cleanup. This will combine both layers to the reference layer. The fill layer will be blank.

merge-up-tooltip.title: Merge the reference layer up to the fill layer
merge-up-tooltip.description: This is useful if you draw on the reference layer and you want to keep it in your drawing. This will combine both layers to the fill layer. The reference layer will be blank.

layer-opacity-tooltip.title: Merge the reference layer up to the fill layer
layer-opacity-tooltip.description: Change the opacity of the reference layer and Shot Generator layer. You will only be able to see the change if there is a saved Shot Generator shot, or something on the reference layer.

sts-input1.title: Shot Description
sts-input1.description: Describe the shot: for example, medium shot. Press enter to generate a shot image.

sts-select.title: Shot Description Data
sts-select.description: Refine data used to generate shot images.

sts-shots.title: Generated Shot Images
sts-shots.description: Click to refine data for generated shot image. Double-click to use generated shot image as reference layer.

show-in-finder-button.title: Show board in file system
show-in-finder-button.description: Click here to show the board image file in the file system. This is useful for external editors.

prev-scene-tooltip.title: Previous Scene
prev-scene-tooltip.description: If current board is at the start or end of the scene, this will jump backward one scene. Otherwise this will jump to the start of the current scene.

prev-board-tooltip.title: Previous Board
prev-board-tooltip.description: Use the arrow keys to flip between boards quickly to see how the story is flowing.

play-tooltip.title: Play/Pause
play-tooltip.description: This will toggle between playing automatically and not. The playback timing is default 2 seconds per board, or whatever is set as the board duration.

next-board-tooltip.title: Next Board
next-board-tooltip.description: Use the arrow keys to flip between boards quickly to see how the story is flowing.

next-scene-tooltip.title: Next Scene
next-scene-tooltip.description: If current board is at the start or end of the scene, this will jump forward one scene. Otherwise this will jump to the end of the current scene.
